alert.note: Alert for Montgomery (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 1:53PM CST until January 26 at 1:20AM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... East Fork San Jacinto at Cleveland affecting Liberty, Montgomery, Harris and San Jacinto Counties. Caney Creek near Splendora affecting Montgomery and Harris Counties. West Fork San Jacinto near Conroe affecting Montgomery County. East Fork San Jacinto near New Caney affecting Liberty, Montgomery and Harris Counties. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Lake Creek at Sendera Ranch Road affecting Montgomery County. For the East Fork San Jacinto River...including Cleveland, New Caney...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Caney Creek...including Splendora...Minor flooding is forecast. For the West Fork San Jacinto River...including Porter, Sendera Ranch Road, Conroe, Humble, Sheldon...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring. * WHERE...West Fork San Jacinto near Conroe. * WHEN...Until after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 117.8 feet, Major lowland flooding begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:15 PM CST Thursday the stage was 117.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 113.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:15 PM CST Thursday was 117.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 110.0 feet late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 115.8 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 118.0 feet on 05/22/1983. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (2 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun West Fork San Jacinto Conroe 115.8 117.7 Thu 1 pm CST 118.0 116.4 115.5 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 130 AM CST.
